features: MOST POWERFUL AND PERFECTLY DESIGNED STEAM IRON: This mini handy handheld steam iron flouts its size with its performance. The new nozzle design distributes steam effectively time and again to do away with obstinate wrinkles. This convenient Steam Iron works on your clothes almost like an expert to remove the wrinkles fast.
PORTABLE TRAVEL SIZED STEAM IRON: This iron is Light Weighted and easy to fit in your bag pack. The package contains a long built-in 2 point cable. Thus, there is no need to carry an extension cord.

SAFETY PROTECTION: You have to turn off the steam iron when it is not in use and when water is running out. Else, it will have an effect on the service life of this steamer. There is also available an automatic shut-off function when the unit gets too hot or the water level is too low.

ENOUGH WATER TANK CAPACITY & QUICK IRONING: You have to fill the water,180 ml, once below the brim level. It takes hardly 70 sec to heat it up. Once it is heated it will get up to 9 minutes of steam ironing time.
Your satisfaction is very important to us! Any questions, please contact us!

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: When it comes to travel steamers, they don’t get much better than the Lemontec Garment Steamer, which is compact and highly-rated by users.

You’ll get around 7 to 10 minutes of continuous use each time you fill it up, and the steamer has an automatic shut-off function if it gets too hot or runs out of water. When you’re in a rush to get out the door, you may not have time to let your steamer heat up for several minutes. Luckily, Lemontec Garment Steamer will let you prep your clothes faster than ever, as it heats up in just 70 seconds. Automatically shot off over heated.
The Lemontec Garment Steamer is compact enough to stash in your suitcase — it’s smaller than an Pad — and all you have to do to use it is fill it with water and plug it in.
Lightweight design.It is a perfect product for traveling. Electric leakage protection ETL listed. compliance to North American safety standards

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 26, 2019
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars small but powerful!
reviews.reviewText: I am the director of a ballet studio and I needed a new steamer to prepare costumes for our concert (the steamer we had, despite being full-size, was absolutely worthless). I didn't want to spend a lot of money and saw that this one was highly rated.This steamer is quite small and doesn't hold much water, but it is *very* effective. I was able to steam dozens of garments (mostly tulle) fairly quickly with it, and they turned out great. I just kept a jug of water on hand to keep refilling the water reservoir when it got empty.When you first heat it up, the steamer does have a tendency to spurt. I recommend not starting to steam immediately when the water boils, but wait about 20 seconds. Then, as long as you keep it upright, the steam output is consistent and there are few to no water spurts.The steamer is very portable - it would easily fit in a carry-on or overnight bag. The power cord is a bit short, but if you plugged it in above a bathroom sink it would be fine (I just used an extension cord). It's so lightweight that you can use it for a long time and your arm won't get tired.I'm very satisfied with this purchase and am glad to have a reliable steamer at my studio now.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 26, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect small portable steamer
reviews.reviewText: This is a great hand held steamer. My boyfriend can even use it without an issue. Win Win!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 26, 2019
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Versatile and Effective Little Beast!
reviews.reviewText: First things first, I travel a good amount for work. Most of the time for out of country trips to tropical climates so the clothes I bring are light fabrics that wrinkle easily and I absolutely loathe irons/ironing boards... so you now understand my struggle. I was already familiar with steamers as I had a large one a few years back that I loved but it was cumbersome so I gave it to my roommate. Now it's 2 years later and I found myself in need of an ironing solution for both home and travel. As usual I started my search on amazon and looked at a few different models before settling on this one, despite the negative reviews which to be honest did make me nervous and here is my experience:This little steamer is fantastic and takes up about as much space in my suitcase as a pair of shoes! Yes, there are even smaller "more" portable steamers on the market but to me the idea of having to refill the water and wait for it to heat up again for one piece of clothing was not worth the little bit more of suitcase space I could've saved. It heats up within a minute and I can steam a full maxi dress in one fill with this little beast! You do have to get this steamer pretty close to the fabric (for most effective/quick steaming I rub the steamer nozzle directly on the fabric just as you would a normal iron - except vertical of course) as with the full sized steamers the nozzle can be held an inch or two away from the item. Mine does spit water occasionally but it is VERY minimal (1-3 drops per use) and it's normally completely dry and not noticeable by the time I walk out the door/get to where I'm going. Every once in a while it goes through a short period of time while its running that the steam almost comes to a stop for roughly 20-30 seconds (I've come to realize this is not a product flaw but rather the steamer regulating its temperature so it doesn't overheat and break). This shouldn't effect you very much if the nozzle is directly on the clothes as it is still extremely hot so I use this 'cool down' period for tinier wrinkle spots and the edges as I've almost burnt my fingers a few times while trying to de-wrinkle hems while the steamer was going full blast. I also like how long the cord is, which to be honest I originally thought would be a nuisance but I just wrap the cord around the neck of the steamer and it adds barely any bulk to its packing size. In addition to light fabrics I have also used this to steam a 8 foot long tablecloth that I bring along for work. To be fair I only did the front side of the table cloth and it worked wonderfully even over the logo part but it did take me 2 refills so this steamer may not be ideal if you need a steamer for really large items, but that's pretty obvious already by its size. I personally will continue to use this steamer for the giant table cloth since the pros outweigh the cons for my situation.I've had this steamer for less than a month and it's already been used over a dozen times, made it through international travel and shows no signs of slowing down! For the price, you can't beat this deal :)

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 28, 2024
Reviewed in the United States on April 14, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Fast to warm up, easy to use
reviews.reviewText: I hate ironing, and this has become my go-to for de-wrinkling quickly before work. It heats up fast and does a great job at getting wrinkles out. Occasionally it spits water while heating, but I've just emptied it and started over and it resolves that issue. I'm not sure why it does that only sometimes. But overall it has been a game-changer!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 28, 2018
reviews.reviewText: If you select the one star reviews, you will find issues nearly identical to mine, and I wish I’d read all the critical reviews before purchasing. With so many excellent reviews I wasn’t too concerned and unfortunately for me, that didn’t work out. As some others have stated, mine also arrived with some oil on the outside of the steamer near the connection point of the two pieces. I cleaned it off, rinsed out the steamer and gave it a go. The first time, the steamer worked as it should and I was pretty excited. I was steaming a light jersey skirt (an easy fabric to test) and needed to refill the water. After letting it cool down and then refilling and turning on once again, the water boiled right out the top of the steamer in huge quantities. It boils so much out the top that it quickly runs out and has no water to even steam a garment. I didn’t overfill the tank. I didn’t tilt it down too far on an angle. This happened again and again every single time after that original successful use. So not only does it not work, it’s also a burn hazard! This is probably the worst purchase I’ve ever made on Amazon. Not sure if the other reviews are fake or if the quality control just isn’t there. Seems like if you get a good one you’ll be ok but those who got a defective one all had the same troubles! Really wanted this to take on an upcoming weekend trip but it will be returned. On the hunt for a new one.

reviews.reviewTitle: Dudo que sea de uso rudo, pero EXCELENTE para emergencias día a día
reviews.reviewText: Es IDEAL para urgencias y quitar arrugas de la ropa del día a día. No creo que sea de uso rudo, pero la compré Porque no suelo planchar mi ropa hasta que la uso y esto saca de apuros rapidísimo! Excelente compra

I LOVE IT!!!!My only problem is that it's small so if you are planning to use this product to a lot of clothes then you will be disappointed. I can only use this to 2-3 shirts but I'm NOT complaining because I knew from the start that it is small. I purchased this product because I'll be using this more often when I'm travelling.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on May 26, 2020
reviews.reviewText: I have liked because is easy to use and It works good.

Can't use without water spilling out everywhere. Bought it to take on a trip only to find out when using for the first time (while on the trip and past return date) that it doesn't work at all. Water went everywhere. I'm surprised as I bought this one since my sister had one just like it that works great. Sadly, the product I received is completely unusable.
